result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin J Eastman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Benjamin J Eastman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Benjamin J Eastman was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
$200.00 cash bond to be applied towards Court costs.
Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  
In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: and Affidavit for attorney fees - Andrew Harrington $332.00

Defendant Benjamin J Eastman in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  Rachel Payne (now Rachel Kibbe) appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:12  Court relates and gives appearances.
11:12  State relates.

Count #1:  State moves to dismiss.  Court grants motion.
Count #2:  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Court orders court costs ($200 cash posted to apply).  Remainder to be paid within 60 days.

Order for DNA given to the defendant in court.  Submit sample 11/03/15 between 1:00 PM and 5:00 PM.
from Attorney Harrington to Court dated October 6, 2015 requesting new motion date
